nodes.title: feat(tabs): improve tab accessibility
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description
I've made improvements to the tab component by updating the HTML element from <div> to <button>.
This change aligns with the accessibility guidelines outlined in the "Role, Property, State, and Tabindex Attributes" section of the following page: Link to the ARIA tabs example.
By using the  element, we ensure better semantic representation and enhance keyboard accessibility for tab navigation.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
The current behavior of the tab component is using a <div> element to represent each tab item.
🚀 New behavior
With this change, the tab component now uses the more appropriate <button> element for each tab item. This improves the accessibility and ensures proper keyboard interaction with the tab navigation.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):

No
📝 Additional Information
Using the getByRole function instead of getByTestId for retrieving the tab items is considered a best practice for testing accessibility.

@@ -11,6 +11,50 @@ Hello!, I am very excited that you are interested in contributing with Next UI.
 - [Breaking Changes](#breaking-changes)
 - [Becoming a maintainer](#becoming-a-maintainer)
 
+### Tooling
+
+- [PNPM](https://pnpm.io/) to manage packages and dependencies
+- [Tsup](https://tsup.egoist.sh/) to bundle packages
+- [Storybook](https://storybook.js.org/) for rapid UI component development and
+  testing
+- [Testing Library](https://testing-library.com/) for testing components and
+  hooks
+- [Changeset](https://github.com/atlassian/changesets) for changes
+  documentation, changelog generation, and release management.
+
+
+### Commit Convention
+
+Before you create a Pull Request, please check whether your commits comply with
+the commit conventions used in this repository.
+
+When you create a commit we kindly ask you to follow the convention
+`category(scope or module): message` in your commit message while using one of
+the following categories:
+
+- `feat / feature`: all changes that introduce completely new code or new
+  features
+- `fix`: changes that fix a bug (ideally you will additionally reference an
+  issue if present)
+- `refactor`: any code related change that is not a fix nor a feature
+- `docs`: changing existing or creating new documentation (i.e. README, docs for
+  usage of a lib or cli usage)
+- `build`: all changes regarding the build of the software, changes to
+  dependencies or the addition of new dependencies
+- `test`: all changes regarding tests (adding new tests or changing existing
+  ones)
+- `ci`: all changes regarding the configuration of continuous integration (i.e.
+  github actions, ci system)
+- `chore`: all changes to the repository that do not fit into any of the above
+  categories
+
+  e.g. `feat(components): add new prop to the avatar component`
+
+
+If you are interested in the detailed specification you can visit
+https://www.conventionalcommits.org/ or check out the
+[Angular Commit Message Guidelines](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/22b96b9/CONTRIBUTING.md#-commit-message-guidelines).
+
 ## Pull Request Guidelines
 
 - The `main` branch is basically a snapshot of the latest stable version. All development must be done in dedicated branches.
@@ -24,18 +68,48 @@ Hello!, I am very excited that you are interested in contributing with Next UI.
   - Provide a detailed description of the error in the PR. Favorite live demo.
   - Add the appropriate test coverage, if applicable.
 
+
+### Steps to PR
+
+1. Fork of the nextui repository and clone your fork
+
+2. Create a new branch out of the `main` branch. We follow the convention
+   `[type/scope]`. For example `fix/dropdown-hook` or `docs/menu-typo`. `type`
+   can be either `docs`, `fix`, `feat`, `build`, or any other conventional
+   commit type. `scope` is just a short id that describes the scope of work.
+
+3. Make and commit your changes following the
+   [commit convention](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-convention).
+   As you develop, you can run `pnpm build --filter=<module>` and
+   `pnpm test packages/<module>/<pkg>` e.g. `pnpm build --filter=avatar & pnpm test packages/components/avatar` to make sure everything works as expected.
+
+   > To know more about the `--filter` option, please check the turborepo [docs](https://turborepo.org/docs/core-concepts/filtering).
+
+4. Run `pnpm changeset` to create a detailed description of your changes. This
+   will be used to generate a changelog when we publish an update.
+   [Learn more about Changeset](https://github.com/atlassian/changesets/tree/master/packages/cli).
+   Please note that you might have to run `git fetch origin main:master` (where
+   origin will be your fork on GitHub) before `pnpm changeset` works.
+5. Also, if you provide `jsx` snippets to the changeset, please turn off the
+   live preview by doing the following at the beginning of the snippet:
+   ` ```jsx live=false`
+
+> If you made minor changes like CI config, prettier, etc, you can run
+> `pnpm changeset add --empty` to generate an empty changeset file to document
+> your changes.
+

+
+## Getting Started
+
+First, run the development server:
+
+```bash
+npm run dev

+```
+
+Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) with your browser to see the result.
+
+You can start editing the page by modifying `app/page.tsx`. The page auto-updates as you edit the file.

nodes.body:
@camcam2605 is attempting to deploy a commit to the **NextUI** Team on [Vercel](https://vercel.com).

A member of the Team first needs to [authorize it](https://vercel.com/git/authorize?team=NextUI&type=github&job=%7B%22headInfo%22%3A%7B%22sha%22%3A%2235e3bd5a39cc761f07987fae607214e74dccfa1f%22%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%22QmZKA1eq4psWGs4qssr1x1cY8GYNxUs3SKinVdwUB9cZD6%22%2C%22org%22%3A%22nextui-org%22%2C%22prId%22%3A1152%2C%22repo%22%3A%22nextui%22%7D).
Hey @camcam2605 , NextUI semantic values are already prefixed by the plugin https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/blob/feat/v2/packages/core/theme/src/plugin.ts#L137C1-L138

@jrgarciadev  , the values ​​of `color` and `backgroundColor` in baseStyles are fixed by default prefix, that won't allow the developer to change the prefix by themself (e.g: mycustomprefix). So can you review my PR again?


See: https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/blob/71741a115a96164362215564f4dd744655c04462/packages/core/theme/src/utils/classes.ts#L6
Oh got it, huge thanks @camcam2605 🙏🏻

nodes.title: (Docs) Feat/v2
nodes.bodyText:
Closes # Docs
📝 Description

Basic starting point for customize theme documentation page for v2

⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

There is currently no documentation for customize theme: https://nextui-docs-v2.vercel.app/docs/theme/customize-theme

🚀 New behavior

Added a quick, easy way to customize the theme using V2 implementation with Tailwind,

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No
📝 Additional Information

I'm currently building a new app using V2 NextUI, still discovering its features as there is a lack of documentation but I can gladly help with the docs if I figure out anything on my own.


This might not be the most optimal way to change the theme + it is not complete but is also better than nothing, I will of course continually add more details to this page once I understand exactly how NextUI uses next-theme.


This is one of my first pull requests so maintainers feedback is greatly appreciated, would also gladly work on any V2 incomplete work (specifically docs, simple tasks)

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -6,3 +6,83 @@ url: https://nextui.org/docs/theme/palette
 
 # Customize theme
 
+NextUI provides a simple way to customize the default themes, first the color pallet, NextUI uses a color variable primary, secondary color pallet to easily customize your theme any time.
+
+### Customizing theme from tailwind config:
+
+To extend or override a token in the default theme, import the `createTheme` function and add the keys you'd like to override.
+You can also add new values to the theme.
+
+For example, if you'd like to update the colors in the theme to include your brand colors, here's what you'll do:
+
+```js
+// tailwind.config.js
+
+// 1. Import `nextui`
+const { nextui } = require("@nextui-org/react");
+
+// 2. Add NextUI components to Tailwind content
+module.exports = {
+  content: [
+    // (Default)
+    "./pages/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}",
+    "./components/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}",
+    "./node_modules/flowbite/**/*.js",
+    // (Default)
+    './node_modules/@nextui-org/theme/dist/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}' // ++ this line
+  ],
+  darkMode: 'class', // Don't forget this.
+    plugins: [
+      nextui({
+        themes: {
+            purpleTheme: {
+              'primary': '#8667C4', // Required for NextUI components
+              'primary-50': '#F2ECFF', // Required for NextUI components
+              'primary-100': '#E3DCF1', // Required for NextUI components
+              'primary-200': '#D2C7E8', // Required for NextUI components
+              'primary-300': '#BBAADD', // Required for NextUI components
+              'primary-400': '#9F88CE', // Required for NextUI components
+              'primary-500': '#876AC2', // Required for NextUI components
+              'primary-600': '#7350B7', // Required for NextUI components
+              'primary-700': '#503589', // Required for NextUI components
+              'primary-800': '#3A2763', // Required for NextUI components
+              'primary-900': '#2A1C48', // Required for NextUI components
+              'primary-content': '#F2ECFF', // Optional for your own styling
+              'secondary': '#9A2BB1', // Required for NextUI components
+              'secondary-50': '#EED9F4', // Required for NextUI components
+              'secondary-100': '#DFB9EA', // Required for NextUI components
+              'secondary-200': '#D19BE1', // Required for NextUI components
+              'secondary-300': '#C17BD5', // Required for NextUI components
+              'secondary-400': '#AD53C8', // Required for NextUI components
+              'secondary-500': '#9439AF', // Required for NextUI components
+              'secondary-600': '#742C88', // Required for NextUI components
+              'secondary-700': '#5C246D', // Required for NextUI components
+              'secondary-800': '#421B4D', // Required for NextUI components
+              'secondary-900': '#2C1234', // Required for NextUI components
+              'secondary-content': '#4B3772', // Optional for your own styling
+              'gradient-primary-from': '#005618', // Optional for your own styling
+              'gradient-primary-to': '#009F2C', // Optional for your own styling
+              'gradient-secondary-from': '#E5FFEC', // Optional for your own styling
+              'gradient-secondary-to': '#CBFFD9', // Optional for your own styling
+              'base-300': '#C0C0C0',  // Optional for your own styling
+              'base-200': '#DBDBDB', // Optional for your own styling
+              'base-100': '#F9F9F9', // Optional for your own styling 
+              'neutral': '#323232', // Optional for your own styling
+              'light': '#F5F5F5', // Optional for your own styling
+              'dark': '#353535' // Optional for your own styling
+          }
+        }
+      })
+  ]
+}
+
+// 3. Now you can use these colors in your components
+function MyComponent() {
+  return (
+    <>
+      <Button color={'primary'}>NextUI New Primary Color</Button>
+      <Button color={'secondary'}>NextUI New Secondary Color</Button>
+    </>
+  )
+}
+```

nodes.title: fix(input): improved clear button styling
nodes.bodyText:

nodes.title: feat: added locale prop to NextUIProvider
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description

When using server side rendering, the application should be wrapped in an I18nProvider with an explicit locale prop, rather than relying on automatic locale selection. This ensures that the locale of the content rendered on the server matches the locale expected by the browser.

https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/react-aria/ssr.html#locale-selection
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
A11y currently does not work for pages that are not lang="en".
🚀 New behavior
People are now forced to provide the locale to the theme provider, who internally uses the I18nProvider from @react-aria/i18n
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
⚠️  YES! This is a breaking change for developers, users are not affected.
📝 Additional Information
Stuff that's still in English:

Modal close button aria-label
Kbd abbr titles

fix: added missing locale prop in storybook config

https://github.com/jguddas/nextui/commit/f5e17181e56c998095bb1c879a46f42ecd2eb76f#diff-e532952bd45c32acb074f9fe7720015070f7ba4de8ef0fa3a5fce5b0e4a7c3de

We could also add a dropdown to the toolbar for people to select a `lang` and `dir`.

https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/assets/25524993/d4d8d30b-281b-4b1c-b234-7bbc3fe6eb45

Hey @jguddas Add this as an optional parameter

`locale?: I18nProviderProps["locale"]`

nodes.bodyText: Thank you @jguddas, I suggested some changes, the lang should be en by default, so is not necessary to add it to the provider, I'll add then an API for the NextUIProvider to let developers know they can change the locale lang

+
+When you create a commit we kindly ask you to follow the convention

+

nodes.title: fix: resolved rtl direction problems
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description
The quality of v2 is incredible, I really had a hard time finding something to nitpick.
This resolves all the funkiness I could find when setting dir="rtl".
For pagination I haven't yet found a solution, so I set if to dir="ltr", so it does not look broken anymore.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

🚀 New behavior

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No changes for the end user nor the developer.
📝 Additional Information

The total number of potential users is of course an overestimate, because it doesn't take into account literacy levels or competing scripts or usage trends. Nonetheless, at 2,305,048,719 it indicates that the actual number of potential users possibly runs past a billion.

https://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-scripts

feat: added rtl support to switch component
feat: flipped arrow of accordion in rtl mode
docs: added rtl fix to divider story
docs: added rtl fix to card story
feat: added rtl support to input clear button
feat: added rtl support to pagination

nodes.body:
@jguddas is attempting to deploy a commit to the **NextUI** Team on [Vercel](https://vercel.com).

A member of the Team first needs to [authorize it](https://vercel.com/git/authorize?team=NextUI&type=github&job=%7B%22headInfo%22%3A%7B%22sha%22%3A%223368bbcd576f99a0e14237320f7fdedfbfa7c2a0%22%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%22QmNdaXcMmxJt5QyvsyJNLFyFSXnZLoUa9LVqeypmFCXc86%22%2C%22org%22%3A%22nextui-org%22%2C%22prId%22%3A1143%2C%22repo%22%3A%22nextui%22%7D).
Waiting for the merge
@jrgarciadev, can you take a look at this?

Great job @jguddas! 

We're planning on using the `i18n` locale given by `react-aria` to detect the user's language direction and integrate it into the NextUI provider's root. You can learn more about it [here](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/react-aria/internationalization.html#example).

While it's a good starting point, The feature to support RTL on all components requires substantial time and effort on our part so we'll likely roll this out after the v2 release, so we can focus on our immediate commitments without any compromises.

Thanks for all your hard work!, I'll leave this PR open to merge it when we start working on RTL support. 

Keep pushing 🙌🏻

> We're planning on using the `i18n` locale given by `react-aria` to detect the user's language direction and integrate it into the NextUI provider's root. You can learn more about it [here](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/react-aria/internationalization.html#example).

Great minds think alike, I also have a PR for that one :D. https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/pull/1145#issuecomment-1586162974

> Thanks for all your hard work!, I'll leave this PR open to merge it when we start working on RTL support.

This PR is in a mergable state, every component works in RTL mode.

But I understand that you have to review/test this, and that takes time.

Before this can be merged, the following steps need to be run.
- `cd packages/components/pagination`
- `pnpm install @react-aria/i18n --save`
- `git add --update ../../..`
- `git commit --message "deps: added @react-aria/i18n to @nextui-org/pagination"`
- `git push`

I have not done this for now to avoid merge conflict hell.

@jguddas, By the way, tailwind 3.3 lets you write more concisely.

For example:
```css
- "pl-3 rtl:pl-0 rtl:pr-3"
+ "ps-3"
```
Hey @jguddas please check this https://tailwindcss.com/blog/tailwindcss-v3-3#simplified-rtl-support-with-logical-properties
@jrgarciadev any update on this ?

We should add RTL support by using the tailwind start and end helper @sbc640964 mentioned here https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/pull/1143#issuecomment-1600111317.

And do so one component at a time.

Examples https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Aopen+RTL

List of known automatically detected issues: https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/actions/runs/6371397569/job/17293304674?pr=1724

nodes.title: fix: JavaScript default parameters instead ".defaultProps"
nodes.bodyText:
Closes 1025
📝 Description

Fixed Warning: {COMPONENT}: Support for defaultProps will be removed from memo components in a future major release. Use JavaScript default parameters instead.

⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

When using this package, many errors occur for each component used. An error like "Warning: {COMPONENT}: Support for defaultProps will be removed from memo components in a future major release. Use JavaScript default parameters instead." appears every time the application is launched, which can cause inconvenience and lead to potential problems in future releases.


Brief description of the changes:

Replaced the use of defaultProps in components using memo with JavaScript default parameters.
Relevant components have been updated to avoid potential issues in future releases.


🚀 New behavior

After the changes made, the error no longer occurs when using components from this package. The updates avoid these bugs and provide a smoother application experience with no warnings about the deprecated use of defaultProps.

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No
📝 Additional Information
Screenshot of the error for an example:

Why we should use the built-in defaults:

https://notes.webutvikling.org/stop-using-defaultprops/
https://medium.com/@matanbobi/react-defaultprops-is-dying-whos-the-contender-443c19d9e7f1

commit.message:
fix: stories lint and correct props

1. lint errors/warnings
2. add "currectColor" for Switch story
3. change incorrect prop "underlined" for the "NoAnimated" story

fix: JavaScript default parameters instead ".defaultProps"

Warnings "Warning: {component X} : Support for defaultProps will be removed" in NextJS on >18 node.js

nodes.title: feat(table): add onRowAction and onCellAction handler props to table (feat #925)
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #925
📝 Description
Add onRowAction and onCellAction handler props to table.
When looking at the React Aria docs, I noticed that onRowAction and onCellAction are the most similar props as requested in #925. See for more info: https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/react-aria/useTable.html#row-actions.
🚀 New behavior
Action handlers can be used to handle actions that are performed on the table row or cell. You can handle for example a row selection action (clicking or tapping) by adding the following props:
selectionMode="single"
onRowAction={(key) => alert(`Opening row item ${key}`)}

There are more ways to trigger an action and you can read more about that here: https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/react-aria/useTable.html#row-actions.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No

commit.message:
feat(table): add onRowAction and onCellAction handler props to table

Refs: #925

nodes.title: Fix: #1085 - Updated Textarea component to proper resize when controlled
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #1085
📝 Description

Updated the Textarea component to properly handle resizing when controlled by an outside state controller such as useState or useInput

⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

The current behavior causes the form to not properly handle resizing, resulting in a scrollbar appearing no matter the props (such as maxRows) passed in, when such props would typically cause the Textarea to expand accordingly.

🚀 New behavior

The Textarea now correctly expands when utilizing props such as maxRows.

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No

📝 Additional Information
As a consideration, the general typing of for value when using an input allows for string | string[] | number | undefined. This PR does cause this to be assumed to be string which should be fine as all three of the available types are translated to string under the hood.

commit.message: Fix: #1085 - Updated Textarea component to proper resize when controlled

nodes.title: fix: Make entire navigation link area clickable on sidebar for the docs app.
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description

Add a brief description

This PR addresses the issue where navigation links in the sidebar for the docs app were only clickable on the link text itself. The changes make the entire area within the navigation link clickable, improving the user experience.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying

Currently, the navigation links in the sidebar are only clickable on the link text itself. Clicking outside the text in the horizontal direction did not trigger the link. This can lead to a frustrating user experience, especially on mobile devices.

  
    
    

    old_behavior.webm
    
  

  

  


⛳️ New behavior (updates)

Please describe the behavior or changes this PR adds

This PR changes the behavior. The navigation links will be clickable from the whole horizontal area and not only the link text.

  
    
    

    new_behavior.webm
    
  

  

  


💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No

📝 Additional Information
Solution


Wrap the  component inside the  component to ensure the entire area within the NavLink is clickable.


Apply the CSS properties width: 100%; and maxW: 100%; to the BaseLink component within the NavLink. This ensures the link expands to fill the full width of its container, making it clickable even outside the link text area.


Testing
The application was tested after making the changes using the  command yarn test:update

commit.message:
fix: Make entire NavLink area clickable

Problem:
The NavLinks in the sidebar were only clickable on the link text itself.
Clicking outside the text in the horizontal direction did not trigger
the link. This led to a frustrating user experience, especially on mobile devices.

Solution:
 - Wrap the <Post> component inside the <NavLink> component
   to ensure the entire area within the NavLink is clickable.

 - Apply the CSS properties width: 100%; and maxW: 100%; to
  the BaseLink component within the NavLink. This ensures
  the link expands to fill the full width of its container,
  making it clickable even outside the link text area.

This is not tested. Awaiting triage from maintainers.

nodes.title: fix: linter rules
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description
Fix the issue that lint-staged cannot be formatted automatically.
Issue key point:

cannot automatically remove unused imports.

⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

Move eslint-plugin-prettier to the end of the plugins list.

🚀 New behavior

New deps eslint-plugin-unused-imports for automatic removal of unused imports.
Turn of no-unused-vars, unused-imports/no-unused-vars and keep @typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars to detect unused vars.

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No

nodes.title: Feat/card tv migration

commit.message:
feat: migrate Card to tv
feat: migrate CardBody to tw
feat: migrate CardFooter to tw
feat: migrate CardHeader to tw
feat: added extra border widths to align to v1 styles
feat: add @nextui-org/theme to Card package

chore: export use-card hook
chore: convert all card stories to tailwind
chore: add dark theme classes
feat: improved states to support disableAnimation

feat: use slots for card in theme
feat: add styles to drip in card

nodes.body:
@gijsbotje is attempting to deploy a commit to the **NextUI** Team on [Vercel](https://vercel.com).

A member of the Team first needs to [authorize it](https://vercel.com/git/authorize?team=NextUI&type=github&job=%7B%22headInfo%22%3A%7B%22sha%22%3A%220a4969a4d0212cb3a05f36e6a98ffa4f8560e5ff%22%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%22QmZWTvtyAhFS9SRZAvPSMEqNjtWwZzVhYHGDx2Jnje3Sr7%22%2C%22org%22%3A%22nextui-org%22%2C%22prId%22%3A1049%2C%22repo%22%3A%22nextui%22%7D).

Hey @gijsbotje thank you so much for helping us with the migration, it looks good to me, you're in the right direction, the idea is to use the TailwindCSS states `hover` `active` instead of the `react-aria` so in the future we will be able to use the same styles in another framework,  regarding if I expect a hook for each card part, no, I don't, but it would be great to have the card splitter by slots, for example:


```
import {tv} from 'tailwind-variants'

const card = tv({
  slots: {
     base: '....',
     header: '...',
     body: '...',
     footer: '...'
  }
})
```

You could pass the classes to the children by using the utility [`pickChild`](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/blob/main/packages/react/src/utils/collections.ts#L27-L46) or by using a context, let me know if you have any question, feel free to reach me on Discord

Thank you! 🙏🏻
@jrgarciadev aah yeah the slots was one of the things which I wasn't sure about. I'll change that up to use the slots. If I have more questions i'll ask them om Discord 👍🏻

Hey @gijsbotje as I don't have access to your repository I had to commit directly to the feat/v2 branch with your changes, sorry about that https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/commit/91cb12b8bdd8510933c0fecee23e95d8c3cb4206, I will include you in the release notes ❤️

nodes.bodyText: Huge thanks @gijsbotje , I will continue the missing parts, really appreciated it 🙌🏻

No
